newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's GMD to help build Argentina highway.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's GMD to help build Argentina highway.

text.p: A consortium of builders, including Mexico's Grupo Mexicano de Desarollo (GMD), said on Thursday they would construct a $310 million, 55-km highway from Argentina's capital Buenos Aires to Lujan.
In addition to GMD, Companhia Brasileira de Proyectos y Obras, Argentina's Benito Roggio e Hijos and Malaysian IJM Corp. will work together on the project, GMD said in a statement.
The freeway will connect the capital with farming and metropolitan centre Lujan. More than 150,000 autos are slated to ride the freeway daily, the company said.
Consultants to the project include International Finance Corp, Bear Stearns and Cofiroute (Compagnie Financiere et Industrielle des Autoroutes).
